feed.subtitle: The admitted woman-beater hit on an employee of Lasio Professional Hair Care's Grammy gift lounge using one of the most disturbing pick-up lines ever.

link.title: Are Rihanna and Chris Brown Hooking Up...Again?

link.Abstract: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter
link.title: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

content.div:
How can Chris Brown still wonder why everybody hates on Team Breezy, since every passing day more and more vile information comes out about the Grammy-winning singer whose duel performance at Sunday's award show sparked one of the most disturbing Twitter rants in recent memory?

The latest icky tidbit comes from Us Weekly, which reports the admitted woman-beater hit on an employee of Lasio Professional Hair Care's Grammy gift lounge using one of the most disturbing pick-up lines ever: "Can I get your number? I promise I won't beat you!"

Feel like spewing? You're not the only one.

"He and his friends laughed, then one yelled, 'That's his new line!'" the woman tells website. "Ugh! I wanted to throw up!"

Us Weekly reached out to Brown's publicist who, in a backhanded way, managed to not deny the report or mock Brown (or maybe the rep has never had the pleasure of reading his tweets).

"I'd be surprised if Chris said something that stupid," the either very witty or extremely clueless rep said.

Brown's unrepentant actions makes rumours of his reconciliation with Rihanna (who was on the receiving end of Brown's fists following a 2009 pre-Grammy party) even harder to stomach.

According to The Mirror, Brown attended Rihanna's pre-birthday party in a Beverly Hills Mansion on Valentine's Day. (One would think she would know better to invite him to a pre-anything, but whatever.)

Partygoer Katia C tweeted from the event, "If Cupid was here he would be very happy everyone @Rihanna bday party was coupled up."

"All I can say, CB was invited" she continued, "and she [Rihanna] was acting like the happiest girl on her birthday and probably got what she asked for."

The British paper also reports that Rihanna ended the night by dancing suggestively with newly single galpal Katy Perry.

"By the end of the night they started a cake fight and were dancing together while Bruno [Mars] and Chris looked on open-mouthed, cheering," a source told the Mirror. "RiRi made sure Chris was having a good time but then he kept a low profile, spending most of the night in a corner with a few pals."

"At one point Katy danced so much she broke her heels and had to leave the party barefoot," added the insider. "Rihanna also had her own wardrobe casualty when her corset came undone but she didn't let that stop the fun."

jond@dose.ca
